title: Recordings from JetBrains Plugin Developer Conf 2024 Are Now Live
description: On November 7, 2024, we hosted our first-ever JetBrains Plugin Developer Conf, an exciting online event dedicated to plugin development for JetBrains products. We’d like to extend a huge thank you to everyone who joined us and made this event such a success! For those who couldn’t be there or who want to revisit their […]
author: Elena Kerpeleva
excerpt: Couldn’t make it to JetBrains Plugin Developer Conf 2024? No worries! We recorded the entire event so you can catch up on all the sessions at your own pace. Find more details here.
text: Plugin and extension development for JetBrains products. Events Livestreams Marketplace PluginsRecordings from JetBrains Plugin Developer Conf 2024 Are Now Live On November 7, 2024, we hosted our first-ever JetBrains Plugin Developer Conf, an exciting online event dedicated to plugin development for JetBrains products. We’d like to extend a huge thank you to everyone who joined us and made this event such a success! For those who couldn’t be there or who want to revisit their favorite talks, the full livestream and each session recording are now available in our dedicated playlist. Watch the recordings Throughout the day, we covered a range of topics essential for plugin developers. From plugin testing and localization to best practices for handling users feedback, each session was packed with insights from JetBrains experts and experienced plugin developers.  Over 2,000 developers tuned in live, asking 100+ questions in our interactive Q&A sessions and live chat. Agenda highlights: Keynote by Ivan Chirkov, Jakub Chrzanowski, and Andrey Skladchikov Experiences Building a Language Server Protocol Plugin by Chris Simon A Story of Collaboration: The Laravel Idea Plugin and PhpStorm by Adel Faizrakhmanov and Tania Goral From Hackathon to Marketplace: Building a Magnolia YAML Assistant Plugin by Natalia Khodiakova Plugin Testing: Performance, UI, and Functional Testing by Maxim Kolmakov Be Kind and Localize! by Joachim Ansorg Look Ma – No Indexing! by Yuriy Artamonov Building a MongoDB Plugin With the DataGrip Team by Kevin Mas Ruiz and Gaurab Aryal Handling User Feedback: A Case Study With GitHub Actions Manager by Daniel Moran Our speakers shared their unique experiences and deep technical knowledge, making the event engaging and informative. We’re grateful to have had such a vibrant community of plugin developers come together to learn, share, and connect. If you have feedback or suggestions for future events, please let us know in the comments below. We’d love to hear from you! We’re already looking forward to next year’s JetBrains Plugin Developer Conference. To stay up to date on future events, tips, and resources, subscribe to our blog, and don’t miss the chance to submit your own topic in next year’s call for speakers. You can also join our Slack community to keep the conversation going! Connect with JetBrains experts and seasoned plugin developers to get help, share ideas, and collaborate on anything related to plugin development for JetBrains products. html:
Plugin and extension development for JetBrains products.

Events Livestreams Marketplace Plugins

Recordings from JetBrains Plugin Developer Conf 2024 Are Now Live

On November 7, 2024, we hosted our first-ever JetBrains Plugin Developer Conf, an exciting online event dedicated to plugin development for JetBrains products. We’d like to extend a huge thank you to everyone who joined us and made this event such a success!

For those who couldn’t be there or who want to revisit their favorite talks, the full livestream and each session recording are now available in our dedicated playlist.

Watch the recordings

Throughout the day, we covered a range of topics essential for plugin developers. From plugin testing and localization to best practices for handling users feedback, each session was packed with insights from JetBrains experts and experienced plugin developers. 

Over 2,000 developers tuned in live, asking 100+ questions in our interactive Q&A sessions and live chat.

Agenda highlights:

  • Keynote by Ivan Chirkov, Jakub Chrzanowski, and Andrey Skladchikov
  • Experiences Building a Language Server Protocol Plugin by Chris Simon
  • A Story of Collaboration: The Laravel Idea Plugin and PhpStorm by Adel Faizrakhmanov and Tania Goral
  • From Hackathon to Marketplace: Building a Magnolia YAML Assistant Plugin by Natalia Khodiakova
  • Plugin Testing: Performance, UI, and Functional Testing by Maxim Kolmakov
  • Be Kind and Localize! by Joachim Ansorg
  • Look Ma – No Indexing! by Yuriy Artamonov
  • Building a MongoDB Plugin With the DataGrip Team by Kevin Mas Ruiz and Gaurab Aryal
  • Handling User Feedback: A Case Study With GitHub Actions Manager by Daniel Moran


Our speakers shared their unique experiences and deep technical knowledge, making the event engaging and informative. We’re grateful to have had such a vibrant community of plugin developers come together to learn, share, and connect.

If you have feedback or suggestions for future events, please let us know in the comments below. We’d love to hear from you!

We’re already looking forward to next year’s JetBrains Plugin Developer Conference. To stay up to date on future events, tips, and resources, subscribe to our blog, and don’t miss the chance to submit your own topic in next year’s call for speakers.

You can also join our Slack community to keep the conversation going! Connect with JetBrains experts and seasoned plugin developers to get help, share ideas, and collaborate on anything related to plugin development for JetBrains products.

Subscribe to JetBrains Platform updates
